inclusion.criterion: concurrent non-pharmacological therapies will be stabilized for a minimum period of 2 weeks
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: prior to the child's entry into the drug phase of the study. At each medication follow-up visit, a detailed history will be obtained and recorded for all concurrent treatments.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Screening assessment: The child's parent and teacher/daycare provider, if applicable, will need to complete some forms that describe the child's problems with overactivity, impulsivity and inattention.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Child must meet the DSM-IV criteria for AD or PDD NOS as determined via a parent interview on the ADI-R and on child observation via the ADOS, or DD.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Child must have categorical and dimensional evidence of clinically significant ADHD symptoms in multiple settings that have been present for at least six months
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Child with prior failed treatment with an adequate trial of methylphenidate;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Current history of chronic tic disorder (e.g., Tourette syndrome with current severity of moderate or more), or a family history of Tourette's Disorder.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 12 year old girl with Turner syndrome, treating with GH since 6 months ago. She has short stature, delayed in puberty and developmental delay.
